newsitem.title: USA: American Intl Pete agrees Kazakh terms.
newsitem.headline: American Intl Pete agrees Kazakh terms.

text.p: American International Petroleum Corp said on Wednesday that it had agreed terms with MED Shipping, a consortium of Kazakh and western businessmen, to buy a 70 percent stake in a 4.7 million acre oil prospect in the Kazakh section of the Caspian Sea.

It will pay 1.5 million shares to be held in trust which may not be sold until AIP stock price reaches $5.00, 500,000 shares which may not be sold until the stock price reaches $2.00 per share, 500,000 warrants to purchase AIP stock at $2.00 per share plus 1.2 million shares of common stock and $400,000 in cash.
The company said that the cost was less than 10 percent of its issued share capital.

In addition, AIP assumed an obligation to pay the Kazakstan Government three yearly payments of $200,000 each beginning July 1998 for the purchase of existing seismic and geological data on the block.
AIP is required to acquire and process 3,000 km of new seismic data, reprocess 500 km of existing data and drill 6,000 linear meters.

AIP said it expects to finance its obligations primarily from the proceeds it received from the recent sale of its operations in Latin America, anticipated cash flow from refinery operations expected to begin during the latter part of the third quarter of 1997, and from partnerships with industry groups.
